title: Ginnifer Goodwin shared a touching tribute to former “Big Love” costar Bill Paxton
text:
Ginnifer Goodwin shared a touching tribute to former “Big Love” costar Bill Paxton While this past weekend was full of lively Oscar buzz and celebrations of movie magic, it also involved the heartbreaking passing of a super beloved actor: Bill Paxton.
Once Upon a Time’s Ginnifer Goodwin reacted to her former Big Love costar’s death from surgical complications, telling Entertainment Tonight that he was , “a good friend who had a huge heart.” She went on to describe his generous spirit in words that made us melt. “Bill was, I can say, more alive than the others, so his not being a part of the world is hard to comprehend.” 
She admitted that it felt wrong to attend the Oscars without him, though her husband Josh Dallas had encouraged her to go — because Paxton was passionate about “Hollywood history and everything to do with Hollywood tradition.” 
via GIPHY 
“You can always see a piece of his big heart somewhere in all of his characters – even in his villains. And so to pop one of his movies into the DVD player is to hang out with him, and I can do that whenever I need that Bill hang,” Goodwin told ET . Whenever we’re looking to hang out with Bill, that’s exactly what we’ll be doing as well, because he’s had a special place in our hearts since Titanic. 
via GIPHY Along with Goodwin, Paxton’s friends, colleagues and fans are paying tribute to him.
Bill Paxton was, simply, a wonderful man. A wonderful man... Hanx.
— Tom Hanks (@tomhanks) February 26, 2017 Bill Paxton could play any role, but he was best at being Bill - a great human being with a huge heart. My thoughts are with his family.
— Arnold (@Schwarzenegger) February 26, 2017 God bless Bill Paxton. May he Rest In Peace. He was so kind and generous to all he worked with- an eternal child about creativity and life.
— Val Kilmer (@valkilmer) February 27, 2017 At Sunday night’s Oscar ceremony, Jennifer Aniston mentioned Paxton in the In Memoriam section that she presented — it was too late to officially include him in the video segment, but he was honored alongside others who we tragically lost.
Jennifer Aniston remembers Bill Paxton, who passed away today at the age of 61 https://t.co/YN5vKbdGiW #Oscars pic.twitter.com/WnUsjygSse 
— ABC News (@ABC) February 27, 2017 We’re sending all our love to Paxton’s family, friends, and loved ones.
